result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Demetrius Lloyd

1:54 PM Defendant Demetrius Lloyd in court.  Attorney Payal Khandhar in court for Demetrius Lloyd.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Beth Raymond in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests warrant vacated. State made arguments addressing DCPS violation reports. Warrant vacated, defendant to report to DCPS. Previous bail conditions to continue.

Status conference on October 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

12:04AM Court reporter Rowan Thompson Defendant Demetrius Lloyd not in court. Attorney Demetrius Lloyd. in court for State of Wisconsin. Court notes hearings were set for 8:30am and defendant does not appear. State gives update that the defendant was given notice in hand at the last hearing. State request body only warrant. Court will grant and so order. Back on the record at 3:57pm. Defendant in court without counsel. State appears intern Jackie Frank supervised by Atty Frank Remington . States gives update, the defendant appeared at the courthouse this afternoon and meet with pretrial services, who contacted the Court and explained reason. State gives position statement and impacts to the victim rights impacts. State does not object to warrants being quashed and cash bond will remain in place. Court questions defendant on status of obtaining counsel and the defendant responds. Court makes findings and will not issue a warrant in 22CF1262 and will quash the warrants in 22CF1549 and 22CF1700. Defendant waives time limits in all 3 cases. Court sets for status conference.  All the conditions remain in place and Court instructs the defendant to return to pretrial services asap.
Neither party requesting bail/bond modification. Court colloquy with DE on DCPS violation. DE to update DCPS with current address.

Defendant Demetrius Lloyd in court.  Attorney Dan Hess in court for State of Wisconsin. DE is eligible for SPD. Time limits previously waived.
